website_summaries.verdict: Durable dummy will last a long time, while remaining soft and gentle on your dog's mouth.
pros: Air valve allows you to adjust the weight and buoyancy of the dummy
Sturdy and durable plastic materials can withstand being thrown in the water and against multiple hard surfaces
cons: Doesn't come with rope handle, but has a space for you to attach your own

customer_reviews.title: No throw rope
customer_reviews.text: These do not come with the rope attached, nor included. Lucky Dog bumpers always included the rope attached. Price raised; critical feature removed: Growl!! This seller bought the Lucky Dog brand, and are intent on squeezing more money out of customers while simultaneously cutting costs, and increasing profit margin. Google Gun Dog Supply and you can find these dummies, with the necessary rope included and attached, priced Under $5 each. So, either the manufacturer, or, Amazon, think we are The Dummies. Without a cord dogs tend to chew the nub with the hole, ruining the dummy (it will sink). Finding suitable cord to make your own throw rope ends up costing you more time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Rooster Booster

customer_reviews.title: Visibility just what I expected, great feel and perfect size for my dog
customer_reviews.text: I love the black/white coloring, it really did help with my dog Marley finding the bumper if thrown a long distance from her in the water. Just the right feel and weight for throwing. She loves it, but does not want to share...haha. Seems very well made. I would recommend this product.. I've used others in the past, this feels more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Salvetti

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely loves these bumpers (fenders, dummies, whatever you want to call them). She has been training on one of these for 5 weeks now every day several times a day and there is really no sign of wear on it. Great product. The only thing that stopped it from getting 5 stars is because it doesn't come with a rope attached for throwing it. I had a length of abrasion resistant climbing rope that fit it perfect and my superchewing dog can't chew through that, these should come with a foot of that rope attached.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No rope
customer_reviews.text: No rope. I get they maybe don’t want bad reviews from dogs destroying rope but please give me a few inches of rope to start. Puppy loved orange one right away and could find with no added scent. Stronger more durable materials than other brands. Gets less dirty. I wasted lots of time trying different 4 types of rope that would fit small hole or not break right away without braiding. 550 cord is too small unless you take time to braid. At least sell a good rope please.
customer_reviews.author: Floridayogi

customer_reviews.title: KONA APPROVED!!!
customer_reviews.text: Kona LOVES this bumper/dummy. Unfortunately, I wasn't paying attention & on the way home, she chewed it up! Lol! As far as the texture and quality, it looks great. THIS DOES NOT come with a cord, so I'm going to use the old mangled ones cord. I bought 4 more (2 flashers and 2 oranges) for Kona, the flashers (black/white) are easier for her to spot in the surf.
customer_reviews.author: Kai808

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be good quality. A lot of people are complaining that the dogs were tearing these up, they are not intended as a toy, they are for training a retriever. If you want something for your dog to chew on, get a Kong that's solid rubber.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Blue Heeler APPROVED
customer_reviews.text: It will keep the 5* if it holds up. The hole looks beefier then another on I found at the dog park. Love the split color and my Blue Healer recognized it from afar as HIS TOY. He does not get to keep it (due to instant shredding ability). Going to try it in the surf and then we may buy the 6 pack. Do not mind supplying my own rope. May buy bulk cotton rope later. Tractor Supply has good rope toys and leads (also in horse section).
customer_reviews.author: WolfKeep

customer_reviews.title: Dog chewed off end immediately, then is sank
customer_reviews.text: If you have an extremely soft mouthed dog or are using it as a direct to hand training dummy, it'll probably be fine... but it's not a good dummy. The quality of material is quite poor (the hard plastic that just breaks/rips, not high quality rubber/plastic). My dog retrieved it, and within 20 seconds while I was dealing with a phone call had chewed the entire top part off. I attempted to throw it again, where it immediately sank. I'd suggest getting another dummy.
customer_reviews.author: cardinalorange

customer_reviews.title: A Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Our Golden Retriever ripped the training tool within 5 minutes of opening the package. We had not yet even tied a rope to the trainer before she tore it off. Small shards of orange plastic came off, which she tried to eat. We are quite disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: sabres4jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great retrieving dummy, Not a chew toy
customer_reviews.text: It’s very well made and durable, I've been using it to retrieve with my dog in the Pacific Ocean with no water making it to the inside after daily use for 3 months. This is not a chew toy and if you your dog use it as such it will not last. This is a great retrieving tool to exercise your dog and very sturdy and well made if you use it for its intended purpose
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: This should not be used for training purposes. It is not durable at all. My dog who is not a chewer had it for less than a minute and the top part was off in his mouth. I would not recommend wasting your time. Just look at all the other reviews and pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Lee Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Valve fell off within minutes
customer_reviews.text: My English Lab puppy is learning to retrieve and this dummy was a step up in size and weight from the canvas dummies we had been using. After adding water via the valve and screwing it down , we went out back to play/learn. On the second retrieve, I noticed that the valve 'cap' was gone. The dummy is still usable, but I can no longer add and remove water.
customer_reviews.author: orion1113

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the price
customer_reviews.text: Your throw it, the dog gets it. The little back "cork" gets lost in the first two minutes. You don't really need it, as long as you give it an inverted squeeze every few throws.
customer_reviews.author: Allan S Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: NOT a chew toy.
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to buy because some reviewers complained about durability. But the item is exactly what it’s supposed to be, a retriever training tool. You don’t allow your dog to chew on this any more than you would allow him to chew a duck you just shot. He’s supposed to hold it gently in his mouth and bring it straight to you. This retriever dummy does that perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Olga L. Kramar

customer_reviews.title: Long life if used correctly
customer_reviews.text: My rescue pup Winston loves this training buoy! I have given it low durability and sturdiness simply because he would tear it apart in two minutes if left alone, but I’ve ordered 3 of these now and they do last quite a long time if used properly. With daily use at the lake I’ve had these last up to 3 months, which is a tremendous value for a toy when considering a pit bull is using it daily.
customer_reviews.author: gizmo1086

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog retrieval training aid.
customer_reviews.text: Great Dog retrieval training aid. Now have them in multiples, every truck and the pool. We've read the reviews of others, if your dog is destroying these, Dog needs more training. If dog chews-up training aid, what'll happen to the birds?
customer_reviews.author: HavasuChris

customer_reviews.title: Great water toy
customer_reviews.text: My lab LOVES this water toy!! I was originally trying to purchase the Kong brand but it wasn’t available when I ordered. This was cheaper but appears equally sturdy. I’m sure if we let him sit and chew this it would be destroyed fairly easily but as a toy for supervised water play it’s perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I like the 2 color combination with black and white
customer_reviews.text: I like the 2 color combination with black and white, plus the grippy ribs on the surface. But my dog is a power chewer and cannot seem to retrieve this out of the water without piercing it with his teeth...in which case, it fills with water and sinks. But I am sure that this product works fine for many/most dogs...just not mine.
customer_reviews.author: Dalana R Bewley Huss

customer_reviews.title: Can't Stand Up to Strong Chewers
customer_reviews.text: My dog destroyed this within minutes of it being delivered. I left her alone with it for almost two minutes exactly and the top section where the rope should be strung was completely chewed off. I didn't intend it to be a chew toy but rather for fetch at the beach. Unfortunately it never stood a chance and would be dangerous for a dog that hasn't been trained to soft mouth toys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Pool Toy
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely loves these. We throw them in the pool for him to fetch. He's chewed on them like crazy and they really hold up. I ordered one last year and then two more this year so he could have them for the pool and yard.
customer_reviews.author: BAS

customer_reviews.title: Not a cold weather toy
customer_reviews.text: My dog really loves this toy I only wish it was more durable. I've bought 3 in the last year. Cold weather makes plastic brittle and prone to splitting. Once its split, bouncing on hard surfaces makes the cracks larger till it ultimately splits or cracks in half on retrieval. I wouldn't buy a $30 dog toy but I've bought 4 of these already. My dog won't play with anything else. I'll be looking for a similar toy that will last longer in the mean time. Not going to buy a fifth one of these
customer_reviews.author: Blitzen

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Not for use with a pup that still chews. I used it as a river toss for my non hunting labs. Pup chewed threw quickly and it now fills with water. Probably great for it’s intended hunting use so I have it a good rating.
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: Dummy split after 1 month. Second one split after 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: Dummy developed a split in its side after a month. Second dummy split after 2 months. Our lab has a gentle mouth. This is a problem doing water retrieves, since the dummy takes on water when the dog grabs it. About two ounces of water after every 3-5 retrieves.
customer_reviews.author: SanFranEditor

customer_reviews.title: No rope. Not durable.
customer_reviews.text: Throwing dummy doesn't come with rope. Really? Tied our own rope to it, but out lab chewed off the tab where the rope tied within five minutes. Unless your dog's a VERY gentle fetcher don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: M.B.

customer_reviews.title: Great activity for the dog
customer_reviews.text: Used this to encourage the dog to get into the pool. He loved this game. Would gather 1-3 of them or at least try to get all 3 of them and return. They are durable for a dog that loves to chew up stuff.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Good and Bad
customer_reviews.text: I only gave this 3 stars because I am not sure what the plastic nipple is for on there, and it also doesn't have a throw-rope attached to it. Other than that, it seems durable and puppy seems to like it so far.
customer_reviews.author: DivisionBell81

customer_reviews.title: Dog loved it... briefly.
customer_reviews.text: Was very please when I received it as it looked quite hefty. I have a 60 lb retriever that loved it but after only a couple weeks of play, the plastic split and rendered the toy unusable. I did not allow her to chew on the toy, she only retrieved it over and over. One of the other things to note is that the black color is painted on the surface and tends to rub off. I was hoping this was black throughout that portion.
customer_reviews.author: chud271

customer_reviews.title: annoying
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had taken the time to read the reviews. There is no throw rope on this bumper which is ridiculous and just lazy on the part of the manufacturer. Save yourself the irritation and buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Don’t leave with pup
customer_reviews.text: Decent for a more trained dog. Got this for my younger puppy (3/4 months). Don’t leave it around the house/yard because a teething puppy will easily chew pieces off. Luckily I noticed quickly but the little pieces could easily choke a puppy or scratch their innards.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Dailey

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Good buy for the money highly recommended. Other reviews complained about being chewed up easily. My 7 month old lab never had that problem but she's already introduced to live birds.
customer_reviews.author: Kaleb Moseley

customer_reviews.title: Best water toy for active dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this toy. Constantly chewing it when she’s not retrieving it in the water. Hasn’t put a hole in it yet. Usually other toys last not even 5 minutes. 👍🏻👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Braun

customer_reviews.title: Rope hole failed within hours of arrival
customer_reviews.text: I put a rope through the hole to make it easier to throw. We got it yesterday, it died yesterday. The hole broke out! So now I've got this awkward cylinder with nothing to grip, and no way to comfortably throw it. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: garbage
customer_reviews.text: bad deal, my dog eat part of it the first time he play with it, now I have to find a UPS store to return it, we leave 40 miles from the nearest UPS store, BAD DEAL
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Caputo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bumpers
customer_reviews.text: My American cocker spaniel loves these. After finishing her retrieve exercises, she thinks it’s a big reward to let her gnaw on one for a little while. I ordered two orange colored, but wish I had one white too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this. I’m not sure how long it will last, just because my dogs destroy everything. Didn’t buy it for the purpose of training a retriever, just got it because my dogs like fetching bumpers.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: Great but not chewproof
customer_reviews.text: Good product and the dog (English Setter) loved it but it also took him only an hour to chew off the end into small plastic pieces. So, depending on the size of your dog....
customer_reviews.author: Rayadoman

customer_reviews.title: Depends on what the dog likes in toys
customer_reviews.text: My dog did not like it because it's to heavy and hard. I guess it depends on your dog but mine prefers plush toys and plastic bottles, this toy didn't really catch his attention.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Not durable!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for this training dummy. My chocolate lab had it for one minute and tore the entire top of it. Sorry but I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lics82`

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty great low end priced dummy. But, the pup got a hold of it while I wasn't looking and ripped it apart. I wish she hadn't I was looking forward to using this. For those of you looking to make this purchase for a cheaper trainer, I would recommend it. The black cap can be removed to add weight and it floated well. You will have to tie your own rope to throw it.
customer_reviews.author: Nattyak

customer_reviews.title: Not chew proof but good bumper
customer_reviews.text: Good bumper for training but if you leave it lying around a puppy like our yellow lab will chew through it and then it’ll sink like ours did.
customer_reviews.author: GoProUser

customer_reviews.title: Expected to be more durable.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my lab to carry around and retrieve. He enjoyed it but my Dachshund got it and chewed the top off by the 3rd day.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great to training dogs to retrieve or just play at the lake!
customer_reviews.text: We use this at the lake and it’s great! Not an issue with the product but if your dogs chews or grips hard with their teeth, it could puncture and allow water in. We use it for retrieving and then put it away until next time. Our dog has other chew toys that won’t float!!
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Fun for Ruger
customer_reviews.text: This worked great. In sted of biting the water and getting sick from taking in to much water, this was a lit if fun for Ruger. Even great out of pool. He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Creative Gourds by Sue

customer_reviews.title: Great for bigger dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 dogs, 2 of them are a German shepherd and border collie. They love playing fetch with this and it great for the water. They usually destroy their toys quickly but this has lasted us for months with a lot of life left.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey H

customer_reviews.title: Great for German Shepherds
customer_reviews.text: This toy is AWESOME!!! My large German Shepherd loves playing fetch with this at the river. It is very thick and his teeth don’t puncture it at all. You can add water to increase weight but we have not explored that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere for a long lasting bumper
customer_reviews.text: Decent at first, but didn't last 2 weeks before it cracked and started coming apart. I thought it was a fluke so I ordered another. Same problem. I will be looking for something higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Bluejeep

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves to fetch with them!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has managed to chew a hole in the top however he chews up just about every toy he has. He is not a hunting dog, he just likes to play fetch with them. We bought two of them and he loves them! Will be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Valuable training tool, great dimensions and perfect weight for reaching a healthy distance with throws.
customer_reviews.author: MikeRyu2

customer_reviews.title: Lacks Durability
customer_reviews.text: Dog was able to bite through the product during training. Unfortunately I had to retire the product after a month as it was falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: pculter

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Very visible in the water my dog loves it whenever he sees it he gets super excited easy to throw floats well
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Nice little bumper for the $
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of the jumbo bumpers to work with my Newfies. They arrived quickly and as described. I will confirm these are not chew toys as the handle of one was chewed off within a couple minutes rendering unusable (my bad)... The bumper I did get to use worked great. We enjoyed the ability to add weight to partially submerge while working/playing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Torn up in seconds upon retrieving
customer_reviews.text: Destroyed in seconds as he chewed it bringing it back to me. Had to toss it and it was a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Tiff

customer_reviews.title: Great for training
customer_reviews.text: Worked well until the dog chewed it apart one afternoon but he learned to fetch with it well!
customer_reviews.author: Sara U.

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: Okay so my girl destroyed this in minutes. I'd not recommend it for dogs that have hard bites. Also it doesn't come with or have a rope attached as pictured.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Not a Chew Resistant toy.  Hazard for Chewers!
customer_reviews.text: Not a toy for chewers! My 1 year old Golden Retriever chewed the entire end off the toy in less than one minute of giving it to him. Not a chew resistant toy. Pieces came off in chunks which could lead to choking.
customer_reviews.author: Btalk87

customer_reviews.title: Great size, my dogs favorite!
customer_reviews.text: These are my dogs (2 of them) FAVORITE retrieving dummy. I like this smaller size because I can throw it farther than larger ones.
customer_reviews.author: p c.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this if your dog has teeth
customer_reviews.text: The build quality of this item is unbelievably poor. Literally on the first fetch my dog bit through the top loop rendering it useless (and my mid-sized chocolate lab is not a big chewer). Save your money - this item will only frustrate you. Very disappointed. Would have given it zero stars if I could have.
customer_reviews.author: Buck Stallion

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these training dummies!! I have ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these training dummies!! I have tried several other styles, but these are the only ones he likes. Wish they were more durable.
customer_reviews.author: All Boys

customer_reviews.title: Good air valve
customer_reviews.text: My dog prefers these far better than the others that don't have an air valve. Seems like I will have to order a multi color one.
customer_reviews.author: Total Results

customer_reviews.title: Not durable material for pups
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, my 8 month old puppy bit a chunk out of this first time playing. I cannot let him play with it bc he will eat the small pieces of plastic that he can easily bite off. Prob best for an older dog that will play fetch without chewing on it.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Helm

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: I buy these all the time for my dog she love them and they work
customer_reviews.author: sabine jones

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this and hasn't destroyed it yet so it's durable.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Ross

customer_reviews.title: Not For Chewing
customer_reviews.text: Not for chewers. Great for fetch. My dog loves fetching this but I can’t let him chew it cause he bit a piece off.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi H.

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: heavy duty. My dog loves it. Better made than the Browning version
customer_reviews.author: munster

customer_reviews.title: Ripped apart in less than a day
customer_reviews.text: I know it is a training tool but our dog ripped chunks off in no time.
customer_reviews.author: GM-Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Meets Needs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect replacement for my grand dog's toy. My Boxer chewed the nipple off the first one. They both love to chew on the soft, flexible surface. Only the nipple or eye area of the dummy is thin enough to be chewed off. Prompt delivery too.
customer_reviews.author: val

customer_reviews.title: Easily chewed up
customer_reviews.text: Was planning to use for a dog toy in the lake. He had it chewed up in less than 5 minutes. Not a trained hunting dog.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Missing rope
customer_reviews.text: NO rope despite every video from manufacturers say every one comes with a rope.... not impressed
customer_reviews.author: Audra

customer_reviews.title: Short Work
customer_reviews.text: Nice weight when throwing. Faults I see: water does entire the valve and the plastic is soft so as you can see my young field golden made short work (5 min) in chewing the head piece off...... Reattached.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a day
customer_reviews.text: My dog chewed thru it in one day of retrievals and it sank to the bottom of the lake.
customer_reviews.author: Birchwoodbob

customer_reviews.title: Toy and tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun toy and trading tool...water dogs live it!
customer_reviews.author: California Curmudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Tons of Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Labs love these! The knobs help to keep a soft mouth, the material is hard enough the dogs can play with them for hours on end. They work great both in the yard, a field or in the water. Highly recommend for those pets that love to retrieve.
customer_reviews.author: Sabe

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good bumpers for training i would recommend picking them up when ur done if training a puppy mine apparently still wanted to play after we stopped so i could mow and he chewed it up lol totally my fault but they arent indestructible
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: The quality of this dummy was sub par compared to ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this dummy was sub par compared to other dummiess I have purchased. The plastic is flimsy. Unlike most dummies, this dummy does NOT come with a throwing rope, which is silly. I would not purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Cimoch

customer_reviews.title: Failed Quickly
customer_reviews.text: I have a Belgian Malinois, so maybe a lab won't kill it right away? We played for about 3 hours on the beach throwing it in the water before it cracked wide open. It appears the rubber is a bit brittle and started to fracture before splitting wide open. I've tried other ones in the past and this was the quickest of all to break on us.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Clark

customer_reviews.title: New Puppy Loves Them
customer_reviews.text: We have a new 6 month old yellow lab puppy named Sofi We bought these for her training She loves fetching them. Gets very excited and comes right back for more.
customer_reviews.author: Connie J

customer_reviews.title: Better for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: This dummy i better for large dogs. too heavy for my small one.
customer_reviews.author: Estes C. Thompson II

customer_reviews.title: My pup loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My pup loves this! I like the fact that you can adjust how much air in the toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: My dog had it less than 5 min and chewed the top off it
customer_reviews.author: Robin Puderbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Great for play/retriever.
customer_reviews.text: My Labrador loves to p!ay/retrieve this dummy. Easy to throw, easy for her to carry.
customer_reviews.author: kct

customer_reviews.title: Great but not a chew toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy for retrieving for dogs, BUT if they try to chew on it any at all it WILL be destroyed. My dog only had it for about 5 minutes and had chewed the too part off of it which makes it wear it no longer floats.
customer_reviews.author: AnneMarie Tunstill

customer_reviews.title: Great value water toy!
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely loves this! The orange color makes it easy for him to see in the water. My only complaint is that water does leak in- you have to squeeze all the water out of the end when you’re done with it.
customer_reviews.author: DAN KOERNER

customer_reviews.title: Yep, buy this one
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected, cant wait for the weather to warm up so we can try this in the lake. My puppy did chew off the small removably black plastic valve so be careful with young dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: Durable, minus rubber stopper coming out.
customer_reviews.text: The rubber stopper fell out after the first day of using it at the lake. It still floats. Squoze the water out. Very durable, no holes in main rubber piece.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: great price for good product
customer_reviews.text: purchased these as add-on items for less than $5 each. great price for good product. very durable, and well made. have used them daily for a couple months and now visible sign of wear and tear. if you have a dog that enjoys retrieving pick up a few of these and have some fun.
customer_reviews.author: Grouse Guy

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Fog chewed through it in 2 minutes. Also did not come with rope
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not durable lasted less than 3 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this is a very soft item not like the one i had prior. It might work for a non chewer. My dog immed chewed off the end.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: It's a bumper, it does what it should. Though, don't let your pup chew on it for even a second because they WILL tear through it. Mine ran off in the brush with it for less than two minutes and the black pressure adjusement was gone, and the top was essentially gone. This is a large bumper not suitable for dogs or pups under 20 lbs, roughly. By not suitable I mean they won't be able to carry it/get their mouth around it. Additionally, it doesn't come with a rope for ease in throwing. I would suggest buying a waterproof cloth one, not such breakable/easily chewable plastic for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Mia GulanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not for chewers
customer_reviews.text: My pup loves to chew so not a good choice for us
customer_reviews.author: susan patterson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy. Very durable.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. If you don’t let your dog use it as a chew toy ( which I don’t recommend). This dummy will last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T Jones

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful dog training item
customer_reviews.text: My german wirehaired pointers LOVE this retrieving dummy. Can throw very far and floats really well.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: NOT Durable
customer_reviews.text: My dog had this chewed up in minutes of opening it. Will be requesting a reimbursement.
customer_reviews.author: Kassy B

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great receiving toy for a dog. Sturdy, lightweight, and easy to through.
customer_reviews.author: Rea Willingham

customer_reviews.title: Worst Bumper Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the worst purchase I've ever made on Amazon. My dog bit down once and it broke. She's not even a chewer. She bit down to pick it up and junk.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great for older trained dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality except for plugs they fall out very easily. Not recommended for small dogs due to plug.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan P.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good tool. Eventually it started to break down with some wear near the tip.
customer_reviews.author: Kepano

customer_reviews.title: Excellent dummy; well made.
customer_reviews.text: Best training/play dummy I've found. Made as well as those at the big box retail stores. Our labs love these.
customer_reviews.author: B. Allison

customer_reviews.title: Great product for price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and weight for my dog that loves water
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice dummy--maybe too nice?
customer_reviews.text: Someone broke into our car and stole a bag with all my dog's toys in it, including his dummy! How lame is that? He was super psyched when I got this one to replace it. It's pretty soft, so it won't withstand much chewing, but otherwise it seems great. The color is insanely bright.
customer_reviews.author: NoSleepTilBrooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Plug comes out easily
customer_reviews.text: Be careful with the plug. Pup has no problem pulling it out.
customer_reviews.author: Aggille

product_meta.title: SportDOG Brand Plastic Dummies - Hunting Dog Training Tool - Adjustable Weight and Firmness - Floats
product_meta.description: Size:Regular| Color:OrangeHigh visibility orange is good for throwing against all backgrounds. Your dog will see this dummy easily.
feature_bullets: Quality and performance driven products for your pet
Provide a better quality of living for your pet with Pet Safe
